RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 5F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 17000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OUR ANDREW B dueled for the early lead along the inside, dropped back into the first turn, rebid three deep from the outside of Song of the East and drew off to be well clear under steady pressure. SONG OF THE EAST dueled two deep but was on match for the winner in the latter stages. WARRIOR AT BAT chased the early pace two to three wide around the far turn and kept on to the wire. SHELTRFROMTHESTORM dropped back early, was fanned wide into the upper stretch raced even late. TAPACHILL was off a step slow, raced in tight near the three sixteenths pole, shifted in and had no late response. MR. NORMANDY raced near the back of the pack early, was six wide into the upper stretch and had no rally. FREEDOM LIVES was hustled along from the inside and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Normandy
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, 6wd upper stretch, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Tapachill
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, tight 3/16, shifted in

ENTRY.NAME: Sheltrfromthestorm
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, fanned wide upper stretch, even

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 5F Turf CR: 82. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 18000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Since August 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by manage ment to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WARRIOR'S CAUSE dueled for the early lead along the inside and held well to prove best under strong handling. CHIEF REIDER chased the early pair, raced near the inside around the far turn through the stretch kept on gamely to the wire. RUNAHOLIC was hustled along early, raced three deep in the drive and was outkicked late. VINDICATO dropped back early, raced four to five wide into the upper stretch and had not enough. SHARP SENSATION was off very slow, lost a considerable amount of ground at the break, raced along the inside around the far turn, angled though the lane to race off the inside and never threatened. MORNING MARCH dropped back to race mid pack early on, raced near the inside and had no response. ROCKIN THE BANK pressed outside foe and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Sharp Sensation
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, inside turn, angled, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Vindicato
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, 4-5w upper stretch, not enough

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 1M 70Y Turf CR: 86. Allowance Purse 28000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 6 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run th is race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile Seventy Yards.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LADY OUTOFTHE BLUE quickly crossed over to rate along the inside, raced two three wide in the stretch and surged up late under strong handling. WINGS OF A SONG tracked the early pace, had a clear lead near the eighth pole and kept on gamely to the wire. ALL ABOUT ME showed good early foot to set all the pace and weakened a bit the final eighth of a mile. CHA CHA TAP lag early on, moved up three to four wide between in the stretch and moved up to improve position. VANILLA BEAN settled off the early going, raced near the inside around the far turn through the stretch and had no final winning bid. AMEN SYLVIA stalked the pace between rivals down the backstretch and weakened in the drive. CALL ON CLARA was unhurried early on, raced six wide into the upper stretch and had no late rally. SOCIAL ENGAGEMENT stalked the pace four wide from the outside of foes and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: All About Me
ENTRY.OWNER: Nixon Martin Ritt Ryan C and Sahadi Scott

ENTRY.NAME: Call On Clara
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, 6wd upper stretch, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Outofthe Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, surged up, driving, 2-3 wide

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MARCH 6 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 6 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MELODIOUS SINGER showed good early speed to set the early pace and drew off to be well clear under strong handling. NO EASY ANSWER tracked the early leader two deep, took aim into the upper stretch but was no match through the drive. TAPIT'S GIRL chased the early pace inside, raced two to three wide through the far turn and had not enough for the top pair. BILLIEANNE dropped back early, raced near the inside and lacked a bid. STAND BY YOU was shuffled at the break, raced five wide near the three sixteenths pole, lost ground and never threatened.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MONEYONTHELINE chased the early pace, raced two to three wide around the far turn and finished well to edge up under steady pressure. SUMMER ASH lag early on to race far back, raced from the far outside in the lane and closed in belatedly to the wire. HE IS BAD showed good early speed to set the early pace, was clear near the eighth pole and faltered in the drive. LUCKY LEWIS lost his iron soon after the start, recovered while racing wide, raced three to four wide around the far turn and weakened after the troubling beginning. NOTORIOUS REY was hustled along, raced along the inside and had no response. LOOKIN BACK LUCKY coaxed along early between rivals and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: He Is Bad
ENTRY.COMMENT: good early speed, set pace, clear 1/8, faltered,

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Lewis
ENTRY.COMMENT: lost iron early, wide, 3-4 wide turn, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EL POLICIA stalked the pace, made a good bid three bid through the far turn and drew off to be well clear while under strong handling. I'M NOT A BABY dropped back early on, raced near the inside around the far turn through the stretch and rallied late for the place position. FLETCHER STATION was allowed to settle early on, moved up five to six wide into the upper stretch and moved up to improve position. KAZ MUNNINGS pressed the pace from the outside of foe and tired. BROBRO CORMAN broke to the outside, quickly moved up to take the lead along the inside, set a pressured early pace near the rail and faded in the drive. WHISKIED UP lost ground and was eased up on in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Fletcher Station
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 5-6w upper stretch, moved up

ENTRY.NAME: Whiskied Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: lost ground, eased up on stretch

ENTRY.NAME: El Policia
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, bid 3 wide turn, drew off, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: I'm Not a Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, inside run, rally place

ENTRY.NAME: Brobro Corman
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, pressured pace inside, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIGHTOFFTHEBENCH coaxed along early near the inside, angled to race from the far outside into the stretch and finished well to edge clear under strong pressure. MOONSHINE WARRIOR was coaxed along early, had a clear lead near the eighth pole weakened to be no match late for the winner. MADISON COUNTY was hustled early, raced four wide around the far turn and flattened out in the drive. MAKE A SPLASH dropped back early on, raced along the inside through the upper stretch and had not enough. MISS MIA LIA dropped back early and failed to respond. DANCEWITHTHEBAND raced near the back of the pack early, raced three wide around the far turn and lacked a bid. STONE IN LOVE sprinted clear and tired readily. TICK ALERT stalked the pace along the inside and tired readily.

ENTRY.NAME: Make a Splash
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, inside upper stretch, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Moonshine Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed along, clear 1/8, no match late
